<h2 data-start="547" data-end="578">ðŸ› ï¸ TecnologÃ­as Recomendadas</h2>
<ul data-start="579" data-end="955">
<li data-start="579" data-end="636">

<li data-start="637" data-end="681">
<p data-start="639" data-end="681"><strong data-start="639" data-end="657">Pandas / NumPy</strong>: manipulaciÃ³n de datos.</p>

<p data-start="684" data-end="747"><strong data-start="684" data-end="713">Plotly / Dash o Streamlit</strong>: para crear el panel interactivo.</p>

<h2 data-start="962" data-end="999">ðŸ“Š Â¿QuÃ© se podrÃ­a ver en el panel?</h2>

<li data-start="2192" data-end="2286">
<p data-start="2195" data-end="2286"><strong data-start="2195" data-end="2215">DiseÃ±ar el panel</strong>: primero en papel o Figma (opcional), luego lo montamos con Streamlit.</p>

<p data-start="323" data-end="465">Si <strong data-start="326" data-end="369">no te devuelve algo como <code data-start="353" data-end="367">Python 3.x.x</code></strong>, tendrÃ¡s que instalar <a data-start="392" data-end="464" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://www.python.org/downloads/windows/">Python desde la web oficial</a>.</p>

<p data-start="283" data-end="354">Si te devuelve algo como <code data-start="308" data-end="322">Python 3.x.x</code>, perfecto.<br data-start="333" data-end="336">

<blockquote data-start="552" data-end="584">

<p data-start="630" data-end="743">Este comando fuerza la instalaciÃ³n usando el mÃ³dulo <code data-start="682" data-end="687">pip</code> del propio Python, que suele evitar errores de entorno.</p>
<hr data-start="745" data-end="748">
<h2 data-start="750" data-end="788">âœ… 3. Ejecuta Streamlit desde Python</h2>
<p data-start="790" data-end="847">Una vez instalada, en lugar de usar <code data-start="826" data-end="837">streamlit</code>, escribe:</p>

<h2 data-start="1024" data-end="1053">ðŸ” Si nada de eso funciona</h2>

<p data-start="1279" data-end="1406">Si <strong data-start="1282" data-end="1301">no aparece nada</strong>, entonces no se instalÃ³.<br data-start="1326" data-end="1329">
Si sÃ­ aparece, mira en quÃ© carpeta estÃ¡ y asegÃºrate de que estÃ© en tu <code data-start="1399" data-end="1405">PATH</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="1408" data-end="1411">
<p data-start="1413" data-end="1575">Â¿Quieres que prepare un entorno virtual (<code data-start="1454" data-end="1460">venv</code>) paso a paso para aislar el proyecto y asegurarnos de que todo funcione en ese entorno?<br data-start="1548" data-end="1551">

<hr data-start="101" data-end="104">
<h3 data-start="106" data-end="168">ðŸ§© <strong data-start="113" data-end="168">Causa 1: El navegador se abre pero no hay contenido</strong></h3>
<p data-start="169" data-end="272">Esto suele pasar si hay un <strong data-start="196" data-end="233">error dentro del archivo <code data-start="223" data-end="231">app.py</code></strong> (por ejemplo, en la llamada a la API).</p>
<h4 data-start="274" data-end="291">ðŸ‘‰ SoluciÃ³n:</h4>
<ol data-start="292" data-end="409">
<li data-start="292" data-end="355">
<p data-start="295" data-end="355">Vuelve a la consola donde ejecutaste <code data-start="332" data-end="354">streamlit run app.py</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="356" data-end="409">
<p data-start="359" data-end="409">Revisa si aparece un <strong data-start="380" data-end="408">mensaje de error en rojo</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="411" data-end="572">Si lo hay, <strong data-start="422" data-end="445">copia y pÃ©galo aquÃ­</strong> para que te diga exactamente quÃ© estÃ¡ fallando (puede ser algo tan simple como que la API devolviÃ³ vacÃ­o o fallÃ³ la conexiÃ³n).</p>
<hr data-start="574" data-end="577">
<h3 data-start="579" data-end="631">ðŸ§© <strong data-start="586" data-end="631">Causa 2: La app tarda en cargar los datos</strong></h3>
<p data-start="633" data-end="755">Si tu conexiÃ³n a internet es lenta o la API de Open-Meteo estÃ¡ ocupada, puede tardar varios segundos en mostrar contenido.</p>
<h4 data-start="757" data-end="774">ðŸ‘‰ SoluciÃ³n:</h4>
<ul data-start="775" data-end="984">
<li data-start="775" data-end="833">
<p data-start="777" data-end="833">Espera unos segundos (normalmente tarda entre 5 y 15 s).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="834" data-end="877">
<p data-start="836" data-end="877">Revisa que no haya errores en la consola.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="878" data-end="984">
<p data-start="880" data-end="984">Si lo deseas, puedo modificar el cÃ³digo para mostrar un mensaje como â€œâ³ Cargando datosâ€¦â€ mientras tanto.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="986" data-end="989">
<h3 data-start="991" data-end="1039">ðŸ§© <strong data-start="998" data-end="1039">Causa 3: El navegador no recargÃ³ bien</strong></h3>

<h2 data-start="214" data-end="292">âœ… OpciÃ³n 1 (recomendada): Activar entorno usando <code data-start="266" data-end="271">CMD</code> (sÃ­ permite scripts)</h2>

</li>

class="text-token-text-primary w-full" dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-21" data-scroll-anchor="false" style="scroll-margin-top: -3316px;"><h5 class="sr-only">TÃº dijiste:</h5><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="e42ebbd5-e9cc-4890-8c74-3f88af281b52" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">ya lo solucione pero sigue sin salir nada este es  el codigoimport streamlit as st
import requests
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

# Coordenadas de los spots de surf
SPOTS = {
    "La CÃ­cer": (28.1288, -15.4391),
    "El Confital": (28.1441, -15.4340),
    "La Laja": (28.0747, -15.4123),
    "San AndrÃ©s": (28.1346, -15.4612),
}

# Funciones auxiliares para obtener datos de Open-Meteo
def get_wave_data(lat, lon, start_date, end_date):
    url = "https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"
    params = {
        "latitude": lat,
        "longitude": lon,
        "hourly": ",".join([
            "wave_height",
            "wave_direction",
            "wave_period",
            "wind_speed",
            "wind_direction",
            "sea_surface_temperature"
        ]),
        "start_date": start_date,
        "end_date": end_date,
        "timezone": "auto"
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data["hourly"])
    df["time"] = pd.to_datetime(df["time"])
    return df

# Interfaz de Streamlit
st.set_page_config(page_title="Surf Dashboard - Canarias", layout="wide")
st.title("ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria")

spot_name = st.selectbox("Selecciona un spot de surf:", list(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

# Fechas para obtener datos actuales y de los Ãºltimos 3 dÃ­as
hoy = datetime.utcnow().date()
ayer = hoy - timedelta(days=1)
antier = hoy - timedelta(days=2)
inicio = antier.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=1)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")

# Obtener datos de Open-Meteo
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

# Mostrar resumen actual
st.subheader(f"Condiciones actuales en {spot_name}")
actual = data.iloc[-1]
col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(3)
col1.metric("Altura de ola", f"{actual['wave_height']:.2f} m")
col2.metric("Viento", f"{actual['wind_speed']:.1f} km/h")
col3.metric("Temp. del mar", f"{actual['sea_surface_temperature']:.1f} Â°C")

# Mostrar grÃ¡ficos
st.subheader("ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas (72h)")
fig1 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wave_height", title="Altura de las olas (m)")
fig2 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wave_period", title="Periodo de las olas (s)")
fig3 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wind_speed", title="Velocidad del viento (km/h)")

st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=True)
st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=True)
st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=True)

st.caption("Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com")

data-testid="copy-turn-action-button" data-state="closed"><span class="touch:w-10 flex h-8 w-8 items-center justify-center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon"><path d="M12.668 10.667C12.668 9.95614 12.668 9.46258 12.6367 9.0791C12.6137 8.79732 12.5758 8.60761 12.5244 8.46387L12.4688 8.33399C12.3148 8.03193 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar en Streamlit lo que recibimos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Devuelve df vacÃ­o</span></span><span>
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame estÃ¡ vacÃ­o."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1478" data-end="1554">Esto te mostrarÃ¡ si la API estÃ¡ respondiendo con datos o si hay algÃºn error.</p>
<hr data-start="1556" data-end="1559">
<h2 data-start="1561" data-end="1608">2. Controla el caso en que <code data-start="1591" data-end="1597">data</code> estÃ© vacÃ­o</h2>
<p data-start="1610" data-end="1678">DespuÃ©s de obtener los datos, comprueba si el DataFrame tiene filas:</p>

language-python"><span><span>data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} Â°C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar grÃ¡ficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas (72h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="2653" data-end="2656">
<h2 data-start="2658" data-end="2679">3. Posibles causas</h2>
<ul data-start="2681" data-end="2978">
<li data-start="2681" data-end="2857">
<p data-start="2683" data-end="2857"><strong data-start="2683" data-end="2709">Fechas fuera de rango:</strong> Es posible que la API no tenga datos histÃ³ricos para los dÃ­as que estÃ¡s pidiendo. Prueba a poner fechas mÃ¡s recientes o solo el dÃ­a actual (<code data-start="2850" data-end="2855">hoy</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2859" data-end="2978">
<p data-start="2861" data-end="2978"><strong data-start="2861" data-end="2886">ParÃ¡metros de la API:</strong> Verifica que los parÃ¡metros sean correctos. Open-Meteo suele cambiar la API con frecuencia.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2980" data-end="2983">
<h2 data-start="2985" data-end="3032">4. Prueba rÃ¡pida: solo datos de hoy y maÃ±ana</h2>
<p data-start="3034" data-end="3128">Cambia las fechas asÃ­ para asegurarte de que pides solo datos actuales y futuros (predicciÃ³n):</p>

2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La CÃ­cer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1288</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4391</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San AndrÃ©s"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1346</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4612</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para obtener datos de Open-Meteo</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar datos crudos para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame estÃ¡ vacÃ­o."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Interfaz Streamlit</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas: solo hoy y maÃ±ana para asegurar datos disponibles</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.utcnow().date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Obtener datos</span></span><span>
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} Â°C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar grÃ¡ficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="3099" data-end="3102">
<h3 data-start="3104" data-end="3119">Â¿QuÃ© hacer?</h3>
<ul data-start="3121" data-end="3323">
<li data-start="3121" data-end="3235">
<p data-start="3123" data-end="3235">Ejecuta la app con este cÃ³digo y fÃ­jate en la salida de <code data-start="3179" data-end="3200">"Datos crudos API:"</code> para entender quÃ© devuelve la API.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3236" data-end="3323">
<p data-start="3238" data-end="3323">Si te sale algo extraÃ±o o sin datos, mÃ¡ndame esa parte para ayudarte a interpretarla.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="3325" data-end="3437" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Â¿Quieres que tambiÃ©n te prepare cÃ³mo aÃ±adir el mapa interactivo con esos spots para que lo integres en esta <p data-start="368" data-end="451">Esto crea un objeto <code data-start="388" data-end="398">datetime</code> con zona horaria UTC, y luego sacamos solo la fecha.</p>

4.11328C18.5474 5.52355 18.5476 7.81057 17.1377 9.2207L10.8457 15.5117C10.522 15.8354 10.2868 16.0723 10.0547 16.2627L9.82031 16.4395C9.61539 16.5794 9.39783 16.7003 9.1709 16.7998L8.94141 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta, timezone

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La CÃ­cer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1288</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4391</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San AndrÃ©s"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1346</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4612</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para obtener datos de Open-Meteo</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar datos crudos para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame estÃ¡ vacÃ­o."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Interfaz Streamlit</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas: solo hoy y maÃ±ana para asegurar datos disponibles</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Obtener datos</span></span><span>
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} Â°C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar grÃ¡ficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="2962" data-end="3033">Solo reemplaza el contenido de tu <code data-start="2996" data-end="3004">app.py</code> con este y ejecuta de nuevo.</p>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="238" data-end="361">indica que la API de Open-Meteo no reconoce la cadena que estÃ¡s enviando en el parÃ¡metro <code data-start="327" data-end="335">hourly</code> para los datos marinos.</p>
<hr data-start="363" data-end="366">
<h1 data-start="368" data-end="382">Â¿QuÃ© ocurre?</h1>
<p data-start="384" data-end="562"><strong data-start="384" data-end="489">La API de marine (<a data-start="404" data-end="447" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="" href="https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine">https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine</a>) no admite todos esos parÃ¡metros juntos</strong>, o quizÃ¡ algunos nombres de variables estÃ¡n mal o no se pueden combinar.</p>
<hr data-start="564" data-end="567">
<h1 data-start="569" data-end="580">SoluciÃ³n:</h1>
<h2 data-start="582" data-end="629">1. Revisa quÃ© variables acepta la API Marine</h2>
<p data-start="631" data-end="785">En la <a data-start="637" data-end="736" class="cursor-pointer" rel="noopener" target="_new">documentaciÃ³n oficial de Open-Meteo Marine API</a> las variables marinas vÃ¡lidas para <code data-start="772" data-end="780">hourly</code> son:</p>
<ul data-start="787" data-end="899">
<li data-start="787" data-end="802">
<p data-start="789" data-end="802"><code data-start="789" data-end="802">wave_height</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="803" data-end="821">
<p data-start="805" data-end="821"><code data-start="805" data-end="821">wave_direction</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="822" data-end="837">
<p data-start="824" data-end="837"><code data-start="824" data-end="837">wave_period</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="838" data-end="852">
<p data-start="840" data-end="852"><code data-start="840" data-end="852">wind_speed</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="853" data-end="871">
<p data-start="855" data-end="871"><code data-start="855" data-end="871">wind_direction</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="872" data-end="899">
<p data-start="874" data-end="899"><code data-start="874" data-end="899">sea_surface_temperature</code></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="901" data-end="1019">Pero es posible que no se puedan pedir todas juntas con una sola llamada o que el formato no sea una cadena con comas.</p>
<h2 data-start="1021" data-end="1063">2. Cambiar la forma de pasar parÃ¡metros</h2>
<p data-start="1065" data-end="1174">Revisando la documentaciÃ³n, <strong data-start="1093" data-end="1173">el parÃ¡metro <code data-start="1108" data-end="1116">hourly</code> debe ser un array o una lista, no una cadena con comas</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="1176" data-end="1239">Como estÃ¡s usando <code data-start="1194" data-end="1208">requests.get</code>, debes pasar el parÃ¡metro asÃ­:</p>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: [</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>],
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
}
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1514" data-end="1602">Pero <strong data-start="1519" data-end="1531">requests</strong> convertirÃ¡ ese array en una cadena separada por comas igual que antes.</p>
<p data-start="1604" data-end="1693">Si la API no acepta esto, quizÃ¡ tienes que hacer varias llamadas o pedir menos variables.</p>
<hr data-start="1695" data-end="1698">
<h2 data-start="1700" data-end="1756">3. Prueba pidiendo solo las variables bÃ¡sicas primero</h2>

<h2 data-start="2215" data-end="2305">4. Alternativa: Usar la API bÃ¡sica de Open-Meteo para viento y temperatura (sin marine)</h2>
<p data-start="2307" data-end="2355">Si quieres evitar estos problemas, usa esta API:</p>

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_basic_weather</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"temperature_2m,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> data
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="3084" data-end="3087">

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Crear DataFrame con spots</span></span><span>
df_spots = pd.DataFrame([
    {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: name, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: coord[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: coord[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]} 
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> name, coord </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items()
])

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># ConfiguraciÃ³n del mapa centrado en Gran Canaria</span></span><span>
midpoint = (df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>].mean(), df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>].mean())

st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ Mapa de Spots de Surf en Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar mapa con marcadores</span></span><span>
st.pydeck_chart(pdk.Deck(
    map_style=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'mapbox://styles/mapbox/light-v9'</span></span><span>,
    initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState(
        latitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>],
        longitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>],
        zoom=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">11</span></span><span>,
        pitch=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>,
    ),
    layers=[
        pdk.Layer(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
            data=df_spots,
            get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
            get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[0, 128, 255, 160]'</span></span><span>,
            get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
            pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
            auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        )
    ],
    tooltip={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"text"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{Spot}"</span></span><span>}
))
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1201" data-end="1204">
<h2 data-start="1206" data-end="1224">Â¿QuÃ© hace esto?</h2>
<ul data-start="1226" data-end="1490">
<li data-start="1226" data-end="1279">
<p data-start="1228" data-end="1279">Crea un DataFrame con los spots y sus coordenadas</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1280" data-end="1356">
<p data-start="1282" data-end="1356">Centra el mapa en la media de las posiciones para que salga toda la isla</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1357" data-end="1422">
<p data-start="1359" data-end="1422">AÃ±ade un <strong data-start="1368" data-end="1388">ScatterplotLayer</strong> para mostrar los puntos en azul</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1423" data-end="1490">
<p data-start="1425" data-end="1490">AÃ±ade tooltip para mostrar el nombre del spot al pasar el ratÃ³n</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1492" data-end="1495">
<h2 data-start="1497" data-end="1517">Para que funcione</h2>
<ul data-start="1519" data-end="1688">
<li data-start="1519" data-end="1591">
<p data-start="1521" data-end="1591">Necesitas tener instalado <code data-start="1547" data-end="1555">pydeck</code> (normalmente viene con Streamlit)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1592" data-end="1688">
<p data-start="1594" data-end="1688">El mapa usa Mapbox, pero Streamlit ya gestiona la clave pÃºblica, no necesitas hacer nada extra</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1690" data-end="1693">
<p data-start="1695" data-end="1805" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Si quieres, te genero el archivo completo <code data-start="1737" data-end="1745">app.py</code> con esta funciÃ³n ya integrada y todo funcionando. <h2 data-start="211" data-end="231">CÃ³mo solucionarlo</h2>
<h3 data-start="233" data-end="309">OpciÃ³n 1: Usar un mapa base pÃºblico alternativo (sin necesidad de token)</h3>
<p data-start="311" data-end="398">Puedes cambiar el <code data-start="329" data-end="340">map_style</code> por un estilo pÃºblico que no necesite token, por ejemplo:</p>

<h3 data-start="1461" data-end="1479">Resumen rÃ¡pido</h3>
<p data-start="1481" data-end="1591">Con solo cambiar el <code data-start="1501" data-end="1512">map_style</code> a uno pÃºblico (opciÃ³n 1) deberÃ­as ver el mapa base y los puntos sin problemas.</p>
<hr data-start="1593" data-end="1596">
<p data-start="1598" data-end="1687" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Â¿Quieres que te prepare el cÃ³digo completo con ese cambio para que funcione directamente?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none <hr data-start="808" data-end="811">
<h2 data-start="813" data-end="834">CÃ³mo implementarlo</h2>
<ol data-start="836" data-end="1061">
<li data-start="836" data-end="1007">
<p data-start="839" data-end="1007">AÃ±adimos una funciÃ³n que, dadas las condiciones actuales, devuelve un texto o semÃ¡foro (verde/amarillo/rojo) indicando si es â€œIdealâ€, â€œAceptableâ€ o â€œMaloâ€ para surfear.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1009" data-end="1061">
<p data-start="1012" data-end="1061">Lo mostramos en la app con colores y texto claro.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1063" data-end="1066">

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">evaluar_condiciones</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">wave_height, wave_period, wind_speed</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Altura de ola</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave_height &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span>:
        altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Muy baja"</span></span><span>
        color_altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ”´"</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> &lt;= wave_height &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1.0</span></span><span>:
        altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Baja"</span></span><span>
        color_altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ "</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1.0</span></span><span> &lt;= wave_height &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3.0</span></span><span>:
        altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Ideal"</span></span><span>
        color_altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ¢"</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Muy alta"</span></span><span>
        color_altura = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ "</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Periodo de ola</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave_period &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">6</span></span><span>:
        periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Corto"</span></span><span>
        color_periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ”´"</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">6</span></span><span> &lt;= wave_period &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">8</span></span><span>:
        periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Aceptable"</span></span><span>
        color_periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ "</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Ideal"</span></span><span>
        color_periodo = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ¢"</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Viento</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wind_speed &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">15</span></span><span>:
        viento = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Demasiado fuerte"</span></span><span>
        color_viento = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ”´"</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        viento = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Bueno"</span></span><span>
        color_viento = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŸ¢"</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{color_altura}</span></span></span><span> Altura: </span><span><span class="hljs-subst">{altura}</span></span><span>", </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{color_periodo}</span></span></span><span> Periodo: </span><span><span class="hljs-subst">{periodo}</span></span><span>", </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{color_viento}</span></span></span><span> Viento: </span><span><span class="hljs-subst">{viento}</span></span><span>")
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="2077" data-end="2080">
<h2 data-start="2082" data-end="2120">CÃ³mo integrarlo en tu app (ejemplo)</h2>
<p data-start="2122" data-end="2210">En el bloque donde muestras las mÃ©tricas actuales, despuÃ©s de calcular <code data-start="2193" data-end="2201">actual</code>, aÃ±ades:</p>

st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"### Indicadores de condiciones ideales"</span></span><span>)

<h2 data-start="157" data-end="172">CÃ³mo hacerlo</h2>
<ol data-start="174" data-end="393">
<li data-start="174" data-end="241">
<p data-start="177" data-end="241">Usaremos el emoji ðŸ„ (tabla de surf) para mostrar la puntuaciÃ³n.</p>

<li data-start="242" data-end="326">
<p data-start="245" data-end="326">Definiremos una funciÃ³n que calcule una puntuaciÃ³n de 0 a 5 segÃºn cada indicador.</p>

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">surf_stars</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score, max_score=<span class="hljs-number">5</span></span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># score es un float entre 0 y max_score</span></span><span>
    full = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(score)          </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># nÃºmero de tablas completas</span></span><span>
    half = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score - full &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>
    empty = max_score - full - half
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„"</span></span><span> * full + (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> half </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">""</span></span><span>) + </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â–«ï¸"</span></span><span> * empty
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="760" data-end="842">AquÃ­ <code data-start="765" data-end="769">â–«ï¸</code> es un cuadradito para tablas vacÃ­as (puedes cambiarlo o dejar espacios).</p>
<hr data-start="844" data-end="847">

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_altura</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">altura</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> altura &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_periodo</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">periodo</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> periodo &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">6</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> periodo &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">8</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_viento</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">viento</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">20</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">15</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">8</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">surf_stars</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score, max_score=<span class="hljs-number">5</span></span></span><span>):
    full = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(score)
    half = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score - full &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>
    empty = max_score - full - half
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒŠ"</span></span><span> * full + (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒŠ"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> half </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">""</span></span><span>) + </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â–«ï¸"</span></span><span> * empty
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="477" data-end="480">
<p data-start="482" data-end="512">Y el resto igual, por ejemplo:</p>

per_score = puntuar_periodo(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_period'</span></span><span>])
vin_score = puntuar_viento(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span><span>])

st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"### Indicadores de condiciones ideales para surf"</span></span><span>)
st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"**Altura de ola:** <span class="hljs-subst">{surf_stars(alt_score)}</span></span></span><span>")
st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"**Periodo de ola:** <span class="hljs-subst">{surf_stars(per_score)}</span></span></span><span>")

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

class="text-token-text-primary w-full" dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-47" data-scroll-anchor="false" style="scroll-margin-top: -6436px;"><h5 class="sr-only">TÃº dijiste:</h5><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="9020dad0-0e16-4edb-b620-d6140ebf0ede" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">integralo aqui import streamlit as st
import requests
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
from datetime import datetime, timedelta, timezone
import pydeck as pdk


# Coordenadas de los spots de surf
SPOTS = {
    "La CÃ­cer": (28.13110735259434, -15.446698859594266),
    "El Confital": (28.1441, -15.4340),
    "La Laja": (28.0747, -15.4123),
    "San AndrÃ©s": (28.14670670936141, -15.555085904921604),
}

import pydeck as pdk

# Crear DataFrame con spots
df_spots = pd.DataFrame([
    {"Spot": name, "lat": coord[0], "lon": coord[1]} 
    for name, coord in SPOTS.items()
])

# ConfiguraciÃ³n del mapa centrado en Gran Canaria
midpoint = (df_spots["lat"].mean(), df_spots["lon"].mean())

st.subheader("ðŸ“ Mapa de Spots de Surf en Gran Canaria")

# Mostrar mapa con marcadores
st.pydeck_chart(pdk.Deck(
    map_style='https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/gl/dark-matter-gl-style/style.json',
    initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState(
        latitude=midpoint[0],
        longitude=midpoint[1],
        zoom=11,
        pitch=0,
    ),
    layers=[
        pdk.Layer(
            'ScatterplotLayer',
            data=df_spots,
            get_position='[lon, lat]',
            get_color='[0, 128, 255, 160]',
            get_radius=300,
            pickable=True,
            auto_highlight=True,
        )
    ],
    tooltip={"text": "{Spot}"}
))



# FunciÃ³n para obtener datos marinos
def get_wave_data(lat, lon, start_date, end_date):
    url = "https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"
    params = {
        "latitude": lat,
        "longitude": lon,
        "hourly": "wave_height,wind_wave_height,swell_wave_height,wind_wave_direction,swell_wave_period",
        "start_date": start_date,
        "end_date": end_date,
        "timezone": "auto"
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write("Datos crudos API marina:", data)  # Para debug
    if "hourly" not in data:
        st.error("No se encontraron datos horarios marinos en la respuesta de la API.")
        return pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data["hourly"])
    if df.empty:
        st.warning("El DataFrame marino estÃ¡ vacÃ­o.")
    else:
        df["time"] = pd.to_datetime(df["time"])
    return df

# FunciÃ³n para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos (viento)
def get_weather_data(lat, lon, start_date, end_date):
    url = "https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"
    params = {
        "latitude": lat,
        "longitude": lon,
        "hourly": "windspeed_10m",
        "start": start_date,
        "end": end_date,
        "timezone": "auto"
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write("Datos crudos API meteorolÃ³gica:", data)  # Para debug
    if "hourly" not in data:
        st.error("No se encontraron datos horarios meteorolÃ³gicos en la respuesta de la API.")
        return pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data["hourly"])
    if df.empty:
        st.warning("El DataFrame meteorolÃ³gico estÃ¡ vacÃ­o.")
    else:
        df["time"] = pd.to_datetime(df["time"])
    return df

# Interfaz Streamlit
st.set_page_config(page_title="Surf Dashboard - Canarias", layout="wide")
st.title("ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria")

spot_name = st.selectbox("Selecciona un spot de surf:", list(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

# Fechas: hoy y maÃ±ana
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=1)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")

# Obtener datos
wave_data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
weather_data = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

if wave_data.empty or weather_data.empty:
    st.warning("No se han encontrado datos suficientes para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot.")
else:
    # Unir datos por timestamp (time)
    combined = pd.merge(wave_data, weather_data, on="time", how="inner")

    # Mostrar resumen actual (Ãºltima fila)
    actual = combined.iloc[-1]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(3)
    col1.metric("Altura de ola", f"{actual['wave_height']:.2f} m")
    col2.metric("Viento (10m)", f"{actual['windspeed_10m']:.1f} km/h")
    # Como la API no tiene temp del mar directa, omitimos o usar swell_wave_height o similar
    col3.metric("Altura ola swell", f"{actual['swell_wave_height']:.2f} m")

    # Mostrar grÃ¡ficos
    st.subheader("ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas y meteorolÃ³gicas (48h)")
    fig1 = px.line(combined, x="time", y="wave_height", title="Altura de las olas (m)")
    fig2 = px.line(combined, x="time", y="swell_wave_period", title="Periodo de las olas swell (s)")
    fig3 = px.line(combined, x="time", y="windspeed_10m", title="Velocidad del viento a 10m (km/h)")

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=True)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=True)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=True)

st.caption("Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com")</div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex
