    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San AndrÃ©s"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.14670670936141</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.555085904921604</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Crear DataFrame con spots</span></span><span>
df_spots = pd.DataFrame([
    {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: name, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: coord[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>], </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: coord[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]} 
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> name, coord </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items()
])

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># ConfiguraciÃ³n del mapa centrado en Gran Canaria</span></span><span>
midpoint = (df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>].mean(), df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>].mean())

st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ Mapa de Spots de Surf en Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar mapa con marcadores</span></span><span>
st.pydeck_chart(pdk.Deck(
    map_style=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/gl/dark-matter-gl-style/style.json'</span></span><span>,
    initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState(
        latitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>],
        longitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>],
        zoom=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">11</span></span><span>,
        pitch=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>,
    ),
    layers=[
        pdk.Layer(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
            data=df_spots,
            get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
            get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[0, 128, 255, 160]'</span></span><span>,
            get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
            pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
            auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        )
    ],
    tooltip={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"text"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{Spot}"</span></span><span>}
))


</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para obtener datos marinos</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height,wind_wave_height,swell_wave_height,wind_wave_direction,swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API marina:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios marinos en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame marino estÃ¡ vacÃ­o."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos (viento)</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_weather_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API meteorolÃ³gica:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios meteorolÃ³gicos en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame meteorolÃ³gico estÃ¡ vacÃ­o."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Funciones para puntuar condiciones (0 a 5)</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_altura</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">altura</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> altura &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> altura &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4.0</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_periodo</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">periodo</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> periodo &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">6</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> periodo &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">8</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">puntuar_viento</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">viento</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">20</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">15</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> viento &gt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">8</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para mostrar olas ðŸŒŠ como puntuaciÃ³n visual</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">surf_stars</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score, max_score=<span class="hljs-number">5</span></span></span><span>):
    full = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(score)
    half = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score - full &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>
    empty = max_score - full - half
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒŠ"</span></span><span> * full + (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒŠ"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> half </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">""</span></span><span>) + </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â–«ï¸"</span></span><span> * empty


</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Interfaz Streamlit</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas: hoy y maÃ±ana</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Obtener datos</span></span><span>
wave_data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
weather_data = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave_data.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather_data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos suficientes para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Unir datos por timestamp (time)</span></span><span>
    combined = pd.merge(wave_data, weather_data, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual (Ãºltima fila)</span></span><span>
    actual = combined.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento (10m)"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura ola swell"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar indicadores con olas ðŸŒŠ</span></span><span>
    alt_score = puntuar_altura(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>])
    per_score = puntuar_periodo(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>])
    vin_score = puntuar_viento(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span><span>])

    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"### Indicadores de condiciones ideales para surf"</span></span><span>)
    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"**Altura de ola:** <span class="hljs-subst">{surf_stars(alt_score)}</span></span></span><span>")
    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"**Periodo de ola:** <span class="hljs-subst">{surf_stars(per_score)}</span></span></span><span>")
    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"**Viento:** <span class="hljs-subst">{surf_stars(vin_score)}</span></span></span><span>")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar grÃ¡ficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas y meteorolÃ³gicas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas swell (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento a 10m (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="6158" data-end="6161">
<h3 data-start="6163" data-end="6180">Lo que aÃ±adÃ­:</h3>
<ul data-start="6181" data-end="6360">
<li data-start="6181" data-end="6234">
<p data-start="6183" data-end="6234">Funciones para puntuar la altura, periodo y viento.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6235" data-end="6298">
<p data-start="6237" data-end="6298">FunciÃ³n <code data-start="6245" data-end="6257">surf_stars</code> que muestra las olas ðŸŒŠ como puntuaciÃ³n.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6299" data-end="6360">
<p data-start="6301" data-end="6360">Indicadores visuales justo debajo de las mÃ©tricas actuales.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="6362" data-end="6439" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">PruÃ©balo y dime quÃ© tal. <hr data-start="123" data-end="126">
<h3 data-start="128" data-end="184">1. <strong data-start="135" data-end="182">Condiciones Ã³ptimas personalizadas por spot</strong></h3>
<p data-start="185" data-end="427">Los spots tienen orientaciones y caracterÃ­sticas distintas, asÃ­ que podrÃ­as adaptar la evaluaciÃ³n de viento y direcciÃ³n de ola para cada spot. Ejemplo: para un spot que funciona mejor con viento offshore del este, que sea una condiciÃ³n ideal.</p>
<hr data-start="429" data-end="432">
<h3 data-start="434" data-end="487">2. <strong data-start="441" data-end="485">Incluir direcciÃ³n del viento y de la ola</strong></h3>
<p data-start="488" data-end="628">Mostrar la direcciÃ³n en grados y con flechas o compases, que ayuda mucho a los surfistas a saber si el viento â€œlimpiaâ€ la ola o la estropea.</p>
<hr data-start="630" data-end="633">
<h3 data-start="635" data-end="672">3. <strong data-start="642" data-end="670">Alertas y notificaciones</strong></h3>
<p data-start="673" data-end="808">Que el panel avise con colores o mensajes cuando las condiciones sean ideales o peligrosas (olas demasiado grandes, viento muy fuerte).</p>
<hr data-start="810" data-end="813">
<h3 data-start="815" data-end="851">4. <strong data-start="822" data-end="849">Comparativa entre spots</strong></h3>
<p data-start="852" data-end="971">Mostrar en un mismo grÃ¡fico o tabla quÃ© spots tienen mejores condiciones en ese momento para facilitar elegir dÃ³nde ir.</p>
<hr data-start="973" data-end="976">
<h3 data-start="978" data-end="1018">5. <strong data-start="985" data-end="1016">PronÃ³stico para varios dÃ­as</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1019" data-end="1134">Mostrar una previsiÃ³n no solo para el dÃ­a actual, sino para los prÃ³ximos 3-5 dÃ­as con un resumen fÃ¡cil de entender.</p>
<hr data-start="1136" data-end="1139">
<h3 data-start="1141" data-end="1176">6. <strong data-start="1148" data-end="1174">IntegraciÃ³n con mareas</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1177" data-end="1276">La marea afecta mucho a la calidad del surf. AÃ±adir datos de mareas para cada spot puede ser clave.</p>
<hr data-start="1278" data-end="1281">
<h3 data-start="1283" data-end="1315">7. <strong data-start="1290" data-end="1313">Modo oscuro / claro</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1316" data-end="1397">Permitir cambiar el tema visual para mayor comodidad segÃºn la hora o preferencia.</p>
<hr data-start="1399" data-end="1402">
<h3 data-start="1404" data-end="1444">8. <strong data-start="1411" data-end="1442">Mapa con capas interactivas</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1445" data-end="1592">Mostrar en el mapa no solo los puntos, sino tambiÃ©n capas con datos como temperatura del mar, altura de olas, o incluso webcams si hay disponibles.</p>
<hr data-start="1594" data-end="1597">
<h3 data-start="1599" data-end="1632">9. <strong data-start="1606" data-end="1630">Historial y anÃ¡lisis</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1633" data-end="1743">Permitir que el usuario vea datos histÃ³ricos y patrones, para entender cuÃ¡ndo suele haber mejores condiciones.</p>
<hr data-start="1745" data-end="1748">
<h3 data-start="1750" data-end="1782">10. <strong data-start="1758" data-end="1780">OptimizaciÃ³n mÃ³vil</strong></h3>

<h2 data-start="171" data-end="200">1. Comparativa entre spots</h2>
<h3 data-start="202" data-end="211">Idea:</h3>
<ul data-start="212" data-end="424">
<li data-start="212" data-end="299">
<p data-start="214" data-end="299">Para cada spot, sacamos las condiciones actuales (altura ola, viento, periodo, etc.).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="300" data-end="360">
<p data-start="302" data-end="360">Mostramos una tabla resumen con la puntuaciÃ³n en cada uno.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="361" data-end="424">
<p data-start="363" data-end="424">Opcional: grÃ¡fico de barras comparando altura o puntuaciones.</p>
</li>
</ul>

2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">obtener_puntuacion_spot</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, fecha_inicio, fecha_fin</span></span><span>):
    wave = get_wave_data(lat, lon, fecha_inicio, fecha_fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(lat, lon, fecha_inicio, fecha_fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">None</span></span><span>
    df = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
    actual = df.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura"</span></span><span>: actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo"</span></span><span>: actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>: actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Punt. Altura"</span></span><span>: puntuar_altura(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Punt. Periodo"</span></span><span>: puntuar_periodo(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Punt. Viento"</span></span><span>: puntuar_viento(actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span><span>]),
    }

comparativa = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (lat, lon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    datos = obtener_puntuacion_spot(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> datos:
        datos[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>] = spot
        comparativa.append(datos)

df_comparativa = pd.DataFrame(comparativa).set_index(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>)

st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Comparativa de condiciones actuales entre spots"</span></span><span>)
st.dataframe(df_comparativa.style.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">format</span></span><span>({
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.2f} m"</span></span><span>,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.1f} s"</span></span><span>,
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.1f} km/h"</span></span><span>
}))
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1598" data-end="1660">Esto genera una tabla con datos y puntuaciones para cada spot.</p>
<hr data-start="1662" data-end="1665">
<h2 data-start="1667" data-end="1695">2. IntegraciÃ³n con mareas</h2>
<h3 data-start="1697" data-end="1738">Fuentes de datos de mareas gratuitas:</h3>
<ul data-start="1740" data-end="1904">
<li data-start="1740" data-end="1836">
<p data-start="1742" data-end="1836">Puedes usar APIs como <a data-start="1764" data-end="1810" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://www.worldtides.info/">WorldTides API</a> (requiere clave gratuita)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1837" data-end="1904">
<p data-start="1839" data-end="1904">O servicios locales si existen (puertos de Canarias, AEMET, etc.)</p>
</li>
</ul>

2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_tides</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, fecha_inicio, fecha_fin</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://www.worldtides.info/api/v3"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"heights"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">""</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(datetime.strptime(fecha_inicio, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>).timestamp()),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(datetime.strptime(fecha_fin, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>).timestamp()),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"key"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"TU_API_KEY"</span></span><span>
    }
    resp = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = resp.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"heights"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"heights"</span></span><span>])
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"date"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"date"</span></span><span>])
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se pudieron obtener datos de mareas."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="2621" data-end="2702">Luego lo puedes integrar igual que con olas y viento, mostrando grÃ¡fica de marea.</p>
<hr data-start="2704" data-end="2707">
<h3 data-start="2709" data-end="2805">Â¿Quieres que te prepare el cÃ³digo completo integrando estas dos funcionalidades en tu app?</h3>

2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># --- Comparativa entre spots ---</span></span><span>
comparativa = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (slat, slon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    wave = get_wave_data(slat, slon, inicio, fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(slat, slon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">continue</span></span><span>
    df_sp = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
    actual_sp = df_sp.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    comparativa.append({
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: spot,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura (m)"</span></span><span>: actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo (s)"</span></span><span>: actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>: actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>],
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â­ Altura"</span></span><span>: puntuar_altura(actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â­ Periodo"</span></span><span>: puntuar_periodo(actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"â­ Viento"</span></span><span>: puntuar_viento(actual_sp[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>]),
    })

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> comparativa:
    df_comp = pd.DataFrame(comparativa).set_index(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>)
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Comparativa actual entre spots"</span></span><span>)
    st.dataframe(df_comp.style.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">format</span></span><span>({
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura (m)"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.2f}"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo (s)"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.1f}"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:.1f}"</span></span><span>
    }))
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se pudieron obtener datos para todos los spots."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1570" data-end="1573">
<h2 data-start="1575" data-end="1631">ðŸŒŠ 2. IntegraciÃ³n de mareas usando Puertos del Estado</h2>
<p data-start="1633" data-end="1785">La API de Puertos del Estado ofrece previsiÃ³n de nivel del mar (mareas) por puerto. Podemos extraer la mÃ¡s cercana al spot (Las Palmas) con estos datos:</p>

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_tides</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://www.puertos.es/es/servicios/oceanografia/Portus/DataService.asmx/GetTideModel"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"st"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Las Palmas"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ini"</span></span><span>: inicio,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: fin
    }
    resp = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = resp.json()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"TideModel"</span></span><span>])
    df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="2190" data-end="2273">E integraremos lo siguiente abajo en el bloque <code data-start="2237" data-end="2244">else:</code> donde ya mostramos grÃ¡ficos:</p>

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_tides_puertos</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">port_id=<span class="hljs-string">"Las Palmas"</span></span></span><span>, start=inicio, end=fin):
    url = (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://puertos.es/servicios/oceanografia/"</span></span><span>
           </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Portus/DataService.asmx/GetTideModel"</span></span><span>)
    params = {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"st"</span></span><span>: port_id, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ini"</span></span><span>: start, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: end}
    resp = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = resp.json().get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"TideModel"</span></span><span>, [])
    df = pd.DataFrame(data)
    df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Dentro del bloque where wave/weather data is available:</span></span><span>
tides = get_tides_puertos()
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> tides.empty:
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒ™ Nivel del mar (mareas) â€“ Puertos del Estado"</span></span><span>)
    fig_tide = px.line(tides, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"tide"</span></span><span>, labels={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"tide"</span></span><span>:</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Nivel (m)"</span></span><span>})
    st.plotly_chart(fig_tide, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    st.info(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han podido obtener datos de mareas."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h2 data-start="1047" data-end="1103">2ï¸âƒ£ Usar AEMET (requiere clave y configuraciÃ³n extra)</h2>

<p data-start="242" data-end="400">Esto muestra entre 1 y 5 olas (ðŸŒŠ) segÃºn la puntuaciÃ³n. Si esperabas que esa visualizaciÃ³n tambiÃ©n se aplicara en la <strong data-start="359" data-end="383">comparativa de spots</strong>, aÃºn no lo hace.</p>
<p data-start="402" data-end="415">Â¿Quieres que:</p>
<ol data-start="417" data-end="664">
<li data-start="417" data-end="563">
<p data-start="420" data-end="563"><strong data-start="420" data-end="500">AÃ±adamos las olas como iconos tambiÃ©n en la tabla de comparativa entre spots</strong>, sustituyendo o acompaÃ±ando la columna de puntuaciÃ³n numÃ©rica?</p>
</li>
<li data-start="564" data-end="664">
<p data-start="567" data-end="664">O bien que se muestre de otro modo (por ejemplo, grÃ¡fico de barras con iconos o algo mÃ¡s visual)?</p>

<h3 data-start="216" data-end="247">ðŸŒŸ Ideas de mejoras finales</h3>
<h4 data-start="249" data-end="290">1. <strong data-start="257" data-end="290">Mostrar puntuaciones horarias</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="291" data-end="415">
<li data-start="291" data-end="415">
<p data-start="293" data-end="415">En vez de solo mostrar la puntuaciÃ³n mÃ¡xima de cada spot, podrÃ­as mostrar una <strong data-start="371" data-end="414">grÃ¡fica del score a lo largo del tiempo</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="417" data-end="469">2. <strong data-start="425" data-end="469">Indicador visual de "buenas condiciones"</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="470" data-end="595">
<li data-start="470" data-end="595">
<p data-start="472" data-end="553">Por ejemplo, si la puntuaciÃ³n actual es 4 o 5, mostrar un mensaje destacado tipo:</p>
<blockquote data-start="556" data-end="595">
<p data-start="558" data-end="595">ðŸŸ¢ Â¡Condiciones Ã³ptimas para surfear!</p>
</blockquote>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="597" data-end="635">3. <strong data-start="605" data-end="635">Filtrar por franja horaria</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="636" data-end="720">
<li data-start="636" data-end="720">
<p data-start="638" data-end="720">Permitir al usuario elegir si quiere ver datos de <strong data-start="688" data-end="719">maÃ±ana, tarde o todo el dÃ­a</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="722" data-end="772">4. <strong data-start="730" data-end="772">Guardar favoritos o historial de spots</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="773" data-end="848">
<li data-start="773" data-end="848">
<p data-start="775" data-end="848">Agregar una opciÃ³n para marcar un spot como favorito y mostrarlo primero.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="850" data-end="901">5. <strong data-start="858" data-end="901">IntegraciÃ³n con webcams o fotos en vivo</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="902" data-end="1005">
<li data-start="902" data-end="1005">
<p data-start="904" data-end="1005">Usar si estÃ¡n disponibles pÃºblicamente para cada spot (como las de Surfline, si hay API o embedding).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1007" data-end="1010">
<h3 data-start="1012" data-end="1043">ðŸš€ Ideas para el portafolio</h3>

<p data-start="1047" data-end="1105">AÃ±adir una secciÃ³n en la app con un <code data-start="1083" data-end="1095">st.sidebar</code> que diga:</p>
<blockquote data-start="1108" data-end="1228">
<p data-start="1110" data-end="1228">ðŸ“˜ <em data-start="1113" data-end="1228">Este proyecto ha sido desarrollado por Yone como parte del portafolio del Grado en Ciencia e IngenierÃ­a de Datos.</em></p>

actual, podemos hacer lo siguiente:</p>
<ol data-start="134" data-end="459">
<li data-start="134" data-end="200">
<p data-start="137" data-end="200">Calcular la puntuaciÃ³n para cada spot (Ãºltimo dato disponible).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="201" data-end="364">
<p data-start="204" data-end="240">Asignar un color RGB segÃºn el score:</p>
<ul data-start="244" data-end="364">
<li data-start="244" data-end="281">
<p data-start="246" data-end="281">Verde para buenas condiciones (4-5)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="285" data-end="325">
<p data-start="287" data-end="325">Amarillo para condiciones medias (2-3)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="329" data-end="364">
<p data-start="331" data-end="364">Rojo para malas condiciones (0-1)</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="365" data-end="459">
<p data-start="368" data-end="459">Pasar esos colores al DataFrame de spots y usarlos en la capa <code data-start="430" data-end="448">ScatterplotLayer</code> de pydeck.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="461" data-end="464">

language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Antes de crear df_spots, obtenemos la puntuaciÃ³n para cada spot y el color</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">score_to_color</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Verde</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>] </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Amarillo</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Rojo</span></span><span>

comparativa_colores = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (lat, lon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    wave = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        color = [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Gris si no hay datos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        comb = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
        comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = comb.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
        score = comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>].iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
        color = score_to_color(score)
    comparativa_colores.append({</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: spot, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: lat, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: lon, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"color"</span></span><span>: color})

df_spots = pd.DataFrame(comparativa_colores)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Y luego, en la capa pydeck, en lugar de get_color fijo:</span></span><span>
layers=[
    pdk.Layer(
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
        data=df_spots,
        get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
        get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'color'</span></span><span>,
        get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
        pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
    )
]
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1831" data-end="1984">Esto harÃ¡ que cada punto del mapa cambie de color segÃºn las condiciones actuales de surf. Si quieres te lo preparo completo dentro del cÃ³digo que tienes.</p>
<hr data-start="1986" data-end="1989">

4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copiar</button><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex items-center gap-1 py-1 select-none"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path d="M12.0303 4.11328C13.4406 2.70317 15.7275 2.70305 17.1377 4.11328C18.5474 5.52355 18.5476 7.81057 17.1377 9.2207L10.8457 15.5117C10.522 15.8354 10.2868 16.0723 10.0547 16.2627L9.82031 16.4395C9.61539 16.5794 9.39783 16.7003 9.1709 16.7998L8.94141 11.6942 6.14542 11.8803 6.01953 12.0332L5.90918 12.1797C5.81574 12.3165 5.73539 12.4618 5.66895 12.6133L5.60742 12.7666C5.52668 12.9869 5.48332 13.229 5.375 13.8789L4.97656 16.2725L4.97559 16.2744H4.97852L7.37207 15.875L8.08887 15.749C8.25765 15.7147 8.37336 15.6839 8.4834 15.6436L8.63672 15.5811C8.78817 15.5146 8.93356 15.4342 9.07031 15.3408L9.2168 15.2305C9.36965 15.1046 9.55583 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta, timezone
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pydeck </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pdk

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La CÃ­cer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.13110735259434</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.446698859594266</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San AndrÃ©s"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.14670670936141</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.555085904921604</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># FunciÃ³n para evaluar condiciones de surf y asignar una puntuaciÃ³n de 1 a 5</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">evaluar_condiciones</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">row</span></span><span>):
    score = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.8</span></span><span> &lt;= row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>] &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2.0</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> &lt;= row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>] &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.8</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">10</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">7</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span><span>] &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">15</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">min</span></span><span>(score, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Funciones para obtener datos</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height,wind_wave_height,swell_wave_height,wind_wave_direction,swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> df.empty:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_weather_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> df.empty:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Map color by score</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">score_to_color</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Verde</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>] </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Amarillo</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Rojo</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Calcular colores para cada spot segÃºn su score actual</span></span><span>
comparativa_colores = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (lat, lon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    wave = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        color = [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Gris si no hay datos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        comb = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
        comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = comb.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
        score = comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>].iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
        color = score_to_color(score)
    comparativa_colores.append({</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: spot, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: lat, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: lon, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"color"</span></span><span>: color})

df_spots = pd.DataFrame(comparativa_colores)
midpoint = (df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>].mean(), df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>].mean())

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Streamlit UI</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ„ Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ Mapa de Spots de Surf en Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

st.pydeck_chart(pdk.Deck(
    map_style=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/gl/dark-matter-gl-style/style.json'</span></span><span>,
    initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState(
        latitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>],
        longitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>],
        zoom=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">11</span></span><span>,
        pitch=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>,
    ),
    layers=[
        pdk.Layer(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
            data=df_spots,
            get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
            get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'color'</span></span><span>,
            get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
            pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
            auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        )
    ],
    tooltip={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"text"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{Spot}"</span></span><span>}
))

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># SelecciÃ³n de spot</span></span><span>
spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Datos para spot seleccionado</span></span><span>
wave_data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
weather_data = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave_data.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather_data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos suficientes para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    combined = pd.merge(wave_data, weather_data, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
    combined[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = combined.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
    actual = combined.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]

    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento (10m)"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura ola swell"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar puntuaciÃ³n con olas</span></span><span>
    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"### â­ Condiciones actuales de surf"</span></span><span>)
    ola_url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://cdn-icons-png.flaticon.com/512/861/861060.png"</span></span><span>
    st.image([ola_url]*actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>], width=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">40</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Indicador visual de condiciones</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        st.success(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒž Â¡Muy buenas condiciones para surfear!"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒ¤ï¸ Condiciones regulares. Consulta el detalle."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸŒ§ï¸ Condiciones desfavorables para el surf."</span></span><span>)

    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ðŸ“ˆ EvoluciÃ³n de las condiciones marinas y meteorolÃ³gicas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas swell (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento a 10m (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde Open-Meteo"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="6087" data-end="6090">
<p data-start="6092" data-end="6100"><strong data-start="6092" data-end="6100">AsÃ­:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="6101" data-end="6350">
<li data-start="6101" data-end="6174">
<p data-start="6103" data-end="6174">El mapa muestra puntos en verde, amarillo o rojo segÃºn las condiciones.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6175" data-end="6254">
<p data-start="6177" data-end="6254">En la parte inferior del panel se ve la puntuaciÃ³n actual con iconos de olas.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6255" data-end="6350">
<p data-start="6257" data-end="6350">TambiÃ©n un mensaje claro con color y emoji para indicar si el surf es Ã³ptimo, regular o malo.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<ul data-start="291" data-end="416">
<li data-start="291" data-end="354">
<p data-start="293" data-end="354">Prueba distintos spots y fechas para ver que no haya errores.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="356" data-end="416">
<p data-start="358" data-end="416">Ajusta detalles de diseÃ±o, mensajes o grÃ¡ficos si quieres.</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h3 data-start="423" data-end="454">2. <strong data-start="430" data-end="454">Organiza tu proyecto</strong></h3>

</li>
<li data-start="553" data-end="574">

</li>
<li data-start="577" data-end="635">

</li>
</ul>
</li>

<h3 data-start="746" data-end="783">3. <strong data-start="753" data-end="783">Publica tu proyecto online</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="785" data-end="1073">
<li data-start="785" data-end="995">
<p data-start="787" data-end="847">Puedes usar plataformas gratuitas para apps Streamlit, como:</p>
<ul data-start="850" data-end="995">
<li data-start="850" data-end="921">
<p data-start="852" data-end="921"><a data-start="852" data-end="897" class="cursor-pointer" rel="noopener" target="_new">Streamlit Cloud</a> (requiere crear cuenta)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="924" data-end="959">
<p data-start="926" data-end="959"><a data-start="926" data-end="959" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://www.heroku.com/">Heroku</a></p>
</li>
<li data-start="962" data-end="995">
<p data-start="964" data-end="995"><a data-start="964" data-end="995" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://railway.app/">Railway</a></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="997" data-end="1073">
<p data-start="999" data-end="1073">Subes el cÃ³digo a un repositorio GitHub y conectas la app a la plataforma.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1075" data-end="1078">

<li data-start="1119" data-end="1219">
<p data-start="1121" data-end="1219">AÃ±ade capturas de pantalla, URL de la app online, descripciÃ³n y cÃ³digo en tu portafolio web o PDF.</p>
</li>

</li>
</ul>

language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

EstÃ¡ desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## TecnologÃ­as utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## InstalaciÃ³n y ejecuciÃ³n</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="812" data-end="881">2. Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)</h3>

<h2 data-start="1258" data-end="1285">DescripciÃ³n del proyecto</h2>
<p data-start="1287" data-end="1557">La aplicaciÃ³n permite visualizar en un mapa interactivo los spots de surf con un indicador de las condiciones actuales (alturas de olas, viento, periodo de swell), y un sistema visual de puntuaciÃ³n con iconos para mostrar si las condiciones son buenas o no para surfear.</p>
<p data-start="1559" data-end="1672">AdemÃ¡s incluye grÃ¡ficos con la evoluciÃ³n horaria de las variables y un indicador visual de las mareas (simulado).</p>

Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

EstÃ¡ desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

## TecnologÃ­as utilizadas

- Python
- Streamlit
- Pandas
- Requests
- Plotly
- Pydeck
- APIs Open-Meteo

---

## InstalaciÃ³n y ejecuciÃ³n

### 1. Clonar el repositorio

<pre class="overflow-x-auto"><code>bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio

### 2. Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)

powershell
Copiar
Editar
python -m venv venv
.\venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1
macOS/Linux:

bash
Copiar
Editar
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
3. Instalar dependencias
bash
Copiar
Editar
pip install -r requirements.txt
4. Ejecutar la aplicaciÃ³n

streamlit run app.py</code></pre></div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

EstÃ¡ desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## TecnologÃ­as utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## InstalaciÃ³n y ejecuciÃ³n</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

EstÃ¡ desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorolÃ³gicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## TecnologÃ­as utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## InstalaciÃ³n y ejecuciÃ³n</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="662" data-end="731">2. Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)</h3>
<p data-start="733" data-end="758"><strong data-start="733" data-end="758">Windows (PowerShell):</strong></p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="760" data-end="825"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center <p data-start="462" data-end="479"><strong data-start="462" data-end="477">En resumen:</strong></p>

<li data-start="481" data-end="541">
